title: FOIA Request: Karl Hess (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All records, including cross-referenced files and ELSUR documents, mentioning Karl Hess (1923-1994), a journalist, speechwriter, and political activist. Proof of death is not required, as his death has been widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/1994/04/27/obituaries/karl-hess-a-republican-aide-who-became-an-anarchist-70.html.

As I mentioned, I'm requesting a search for cross-referenced documents as well as the subject's main file, should it exist.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jesse Walker

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: INS/Inscape Seattle Landmarks Preservation Board commentary emails sent to sarah.sodt@seattle.gov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails sent and received by the Sarah Sodt's email address of Sarah.sodt@seattle.gov related to deliberations on nominating the INS Building (aka "Inscape building") for landmark status. Limit the search to a time frame of May 1st 2024 and the date that this request is received. I believe that RCW Ch. 42.56 specifically makes these emails a public record. 

The public was urged to email Ms. Sodt. More information can be found here:
https://friendsofinscape.org/news/historic-seattle-landmarking
https://historicseattle.org/ins-building-inscape-landmark-nomination/

Thank you for the city of Seattle's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you on this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Robert Delaware

title: Pompeo Visit to Cairo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pompeo Visit to Cairo
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All facturas, purchase orders, invoices, and similar documents originated by the American University in Cairo or the Department of State  (Secretary Pompeo and his team and President Francis Ricciardone and his team and executive assistant of the American University in Cairo (AUC)) intended to provide support (e.g., airfare, transport, food and hospitality, security for the event)for the visit to the American University in Cairo, Egypt on January 10, 2019 by Secretary Pompeo. Fiscal communications with or signed by Provost Ehab AbdelRahman (various spellings may be found), the controller at AUC, and Business Services of AUC are included in this request. 

Communications may have been via email (AUC's domain is @aucegypt.edu) but might have been via diplomatic pouch, State.gov email, etc.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Digital files preferred whenever possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dr Thomas DeVere Wolsey

title: Dan Lauber

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Dan Lauber
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, communications, or other responsive records related to the procurement, execution, and delivery of services between City of Coral Springs and Dan Lauber.

Pursuant to Article I, section 24 of the Florida Constitution, and chapter 119, F.S., this request is to include all communications between Mr. Lauber and the City leading up to the execution of a contract (including initial outreach by the City or Mr. Lauber) and continuing to the present which pertain to the services procured and the execution of those services.
 
This also includes the executed contract, and any addendums, extensions, or other components of the agreement between Coral Springs and Mr. Lauber.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Case-Level Reimbursement Records

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Case-Level Reimbursement Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Thanks for fulfilling our previous FOIA request. We had a brief follow up request. Specifically we are requesting case-level reimbursement records from Circuit Court, General District Court, and Combined District Court cases for 6 jurisdictions between January 2019 and December 2023. These jurisdictions are: Richmond, Chesterfield , Prince William County, Fairfax County, Virginia Beach and Loudon County. We are requesting four data points for each case- the jurisdiction, the reimbursement amount, the associated case number, and the date of reimbursement. We are not requesting defendant name, attorney name, or any address information. If possible, we would request this data be stored in a spreadsheet if the applicable database is capable of exporting to a spreadsheet.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Brandon Morrissey.

title: Smc civil rights violation /subsequent cover up (Santa Monica Community College)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Smc civil rights violation /subsequent cover up (Santa Monica Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request and demand access to ALL DOCUMENTS OR OTHERWISE MATERIALS , including the internal/ inter office reports, summaries, files and all other documents there are mentioned here or not mention here that were generated in response to the incident that took place  on 03/02/2020 in the admissions office at Santa Monica college, (which is located at 1900 Pico Blvd., Santa Monica, CA )between myself :
   ( Marley Nesta St. John SMC student ID number 878745), Santa Monica College, Santa Monica College police officers of the campus police department  any employees including  faculty or staff and/or any other persons involved or whitness to the actions that were taken by Santa Monica college employees or faculty and police officers, Including the Dean of students , student ombudsman representatives in regards to the incident or any other reference to a student, Marley Nesta St. John ID number 878745.

In addition, I request ALL concealed, removed , deleted emails and communications Mr. St. John’s Educational student email address as referenced here as : 
1) stjohn_marley_nesta@student.smc.edu 
2) stjohn_marley_nesta@smc.edu. 

It is also requested that any written report or Allegations made by anyone in regards to Mr. Marley St. John, Marley Nesta St. John (student). Including any document or file inserted into Mr. St. John’s student records in regards or related to the incident referenced in this document. 

I request a copy of all disciplinary action(s), documents, or files generated during the time period in which Marley Nesta St. John was a student at Santa Monica community College. 

It is my understanding that Santa Monica Community College is responsible for its police department and any missing documents to this case 
It is requested that Santa Monica Community college produce all police reports that were generated by and for Santa Monica College Police Department, the staff at Santa Monica College, the office of judicial affairs at Santa Monica College, the Dean of students,  including any documents or information that were circulated or otherwise made available to  employees , professors, or other faculty in regards to Marley Nesta St. John


It has been previously stated that there are no audio or video records or recordings existing in regards to this incident. Why have these important records not been retained ?
 Captain Carter did without question make his own digital recording on a device he had at his disposal at that time.   Including Captain Carters recording is of great importance. These recordings are a accurate and exhaustive evidentiary accounting of the incident which resulted I the clear violation of Mr. St. John's civil right's guaranteed under the constitution. Mr. St. John was unlawfully threatened without course or reason that would necessitate threats of violence, intimidation and persecution of an individual who was not threat to anyone.  Mr. St. John was clearly injured and wearing a cast on his broken foot.  Mr. St. John did nothing illegal whatsoever and simply recording the unnecessary and unlawful actions of Mr. Hernandez, who was in charge of the admissions department on that day. It was Mr. St. John's right to record the prejudicial way he was being trearted. Choosing to do so, in order to keep an accurate and complete record of that in which was taking place and that in which he was being subjugated to by Mr Hernandez and the Santa Monica College Police officers who were present that day.


When the officers arrived at the request of Mr. Hernandez at the admissions department officers of the College Police Department identified themselves as Mr St. John was seated Peaceably and quietly Keeping to himself.   Mr. Hernandez then stated that Mr. St. John had been disruptive and abusive.
 The Police department officers at the scene did nothing to attempt to resolve the situation or help Mr. St. John With any difficulties he may  have been having. Nor did they attempt too ascertain the validity of the accusations.


  The SMC PD responding officers did in fact, and without question made demands and ordered Mr. St. John to produce  documents to prove his United States citizenship by surrendering  his passport for inspection, which is governed by United Nations charter and is only applicable to be demanded and or seized At international borders or inspection areas that have been previously established well marked, and those subject to such demands Had willingly done so by entering into these border areas.  These protocols were not followed and without any lawful reason or investigative necessity did in fact make threats of being arrested and trespassed from the school indefinitely and spending time in Santa Monica jail if he did not surrender his, protected documents and sensitive personal records contained in his passport. He attempted to explain to officers involved that what they were doing, was in fact, illegal and unconstitutional, and they had absolutely no right whatsoever or reason or investigative purpose to demand under the color of law his documents and passport from Mr. St. John.

title: Dana Stidham Cold Case File

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Dana Stidham Cold Case File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, documents, photographs, and video and audio recordings related to the disappearance and murder of Dana Stidham.
All audio and video recordings and associated transcripts of interviews with Mike McMillan.
All audio and video recordings and associated transcripts of interviews with other witnesses, Dana Stidham's family and friends, and persons of interest.
A listing of categorized evidence along with photographs.
All photographs, both interior and exterior, and documentation of Dana Stidham's car.
All photographs and documentation of Dana Stidham's body and its location, including but not limited to aerial photos, scene sketches and evidence collected at the scene.
All autopsy and forensic reports on Dana Stidham's body.
All lab reports, including but not limited to hair analysis and DNA testing thereof, if any, and any other forensic files. 
All search warrants or affidavits filed in connection with Dana Stidham's case.
All communications logs including but not limited to phone records and dispatch logs.
All police records regarding the Dana Stidham case, including but not limited to incident reports, supplementary reports and detective notes.
All photography and video and audio recordings taken by non-police persons included in the case file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Christian Monson.

communications.subject: DoD OIG FOIA Request DODOIG-2024-000715
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Mills:

This correspondence pertains to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for "report Evaluation of Combatant Command Joint Military Deception Planning (Report No. DODIG-2024-085) and any associated drafts, memorandum which go to the initial request for this report or the process of generating this report."  We received your request on August 26, 2024, and assigned it case number DODOIG-2024-000715.

As currently worded, your request is not sufficiently described for our office to conduct a search.  We will need clarification on the second portion of your records description in order to process your request.  We are not sure which records you are referring to when you state "memorandum which go to the initial request for this report or the process of generating this report."

The FOIA requires federal agencies to provide records that are reasonably described.  Please note that a record is not reasonably described unless the description contains sufficient information to enable a professional agency employee familiar with the subject area to locate the records with a reasonable amount of effort.  We will hold your request open for 30 calendar days from the date of this correspondence, pending receipt of a more clearly described request for records.

You may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at FOIAPublicLiaison@dodig.mil<mailto:FOIAPublicLiaison@dodig.mil>, or by calling 703-604-9785, for any further assistance with your request.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, MD 20740-6001, email at ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

If you have any questions regarding this matter, please contact the DoD OIG FOIA Requester Service Center at 703-604-9775 or via email at foiarequests@dodig.mil<mailto:foiarequests@dodig.mil>.

Sincerely,
FOIA Requester Service Center
Office of Inspector General
Department of Defense

P. 703-604-9775
F. 571-372-7498
E. foiarequests@dodig.mil<mailto:foiarequests@dodig.mil>

This e-mail is from the Department of Defense Office of Inspector General {DoD OIG}. It may contain Controlled Unclassified Information {CUI}, including information that is Law Enforcement Sensitive {LES}, subject to the Privacy Act, and/or other privileges and restrictions that prohibit release without appropriate legal authority. Do not disseminate without the approval of the DoD OIG.  If received in error, please notify the sender by reply e-mail and delete all copies of this message.

File 65-HQ-40178, on the interception of diplomatic communications from the Italian government during World War II.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2024-816-00818 Closed
communications.communication:
The NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) has denied your FOIL request FOIL-2024-816-00818 for the following reasons: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2024-816-00818) 
 Your request under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) is denied. Please see the attached determination letter. 
Dear Abraham Riesman I am responding to your Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”) request, received on August 17, 2024, which states: To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 1. Police report(s) related to the death of Stephen John Ditko, who was found dead on June 29, 2018 in his apartment at 150 West 51st Street, New York, NY. 2. Medical examiner's report on the death of Stephen John Ditko. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Abraham Riesman Upload documents directly: [omitted]” Please be advised that the Office of Chief Medical Examiner (“OCME”) does not release decedent records/autopsy reports pursuant to FOIL, as the release of such records would result in an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, pursuant to New York State Public Officers Law, Article 6, Sections 87(2)(b) and 89(2). The OCME may release the cause and manner of death once the case has been finalized by the Medical Examiner conducting the autopsy.  Media inquiries are handled by OCME’s Executive Director for Public Affairs, who can be reached at PublicAffairs@ocme.nyc.gov As a non-family member, you may be able to obtain a copy of the complete medical examiner case file (which contains the autopsy report), you obtain an original, notarized authorization from decedent’s next-of-kin which states that such records may be released to you (next-of-kin are spouse/domestic partner, and blood relatives, but only if who are a first cousin or closer). The authorization must also contain the authorizer’s relationship to the decedent; if the authorizer’s relationship to the decedent is legal (e.g., Executor, Administrator, Power of Attorney) rather than familial, a copy of the documentation establishing that relationship (e.g., Letters Testamentary, Letters of Administration, Power of Attorney + Letters of Administration/Testamentary) accompany the authorization. must 
Once you have obtained the next-of-kin’s authorization, please submit a regarding the records to OCME’s Legal Department. The Letter of Request should include: (1) your name, (2) the decedent’s name, (3) the decedent’s ME Case Number, (4) a return address, and (5) your signature. Letter of Request he written request for decedent records, along with the requisite authorization (and other documents, as applicable), should be submitted by email to ocmerecordsrequest@ocme.nyc.gov ( non-family requests only) OR by mail to: The Office of Chief Medical Examiner 
Attention: Legal Department 
421 East 26th Street 
New York, New York 10016 
Additionally, you can find more information about requesting decedent records/autopsy reports on OCME’s website at https://www1.nyc.gov/site/ocme/about/faq.page  or you can call OCME’s Family Service Center at 212-447-2030. 
If you wish to appeal this decision, you may do so within thirty (30) days of its receipt.  You may appeal to: Geoffrey Crary, Esq., FOIL Appeals Officer, Office of Chief Medical Examiner, 421 East 26th Street, New York, NY 10016. 
 
Regards, 
Alison L. Nixon 
Records Access Officer 
NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner 
 
Please visit FOIL-2024-816-00818 to view additional information and take any necessary action. You may appeal the decision to deny access to material that was redacted in part or withheld in entirety by contacting the agency's FOIL Appeals Officer: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2024-816-00818) ocmefoilappeals@ocme.nyc.gov within 30 days. title: Fullerton College and Fullerton Police Department DFR Program

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Fullerton College and Fullerton Police Department DFR Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Access to public records related to the collaboration between Fullerton College, the Fullerton Police Department (FPD), and Flying Lion, Inc. concerning the FPD’s Drone First Responder (DFR) trial program.

This request is prompted by a law enforcement bulletin obtained from the Fullerton Police Department through a separate PRA request, which indicates that Fullerton College collaborated with the FPD on the DFR program. The bulletin specifically mentions that this collaboration led to the use of the call sign "Hornets" in honor of the Fullerton College Hornets. A copy of this bulletin is enclosed for your reference.

Specifically, I am requesting the following records:

1. All communications (including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and meeting minutes) between Fullerton College and the Fullerton Police Department related to the DFR program, including any discussion of the use of the call sign "Hornets."

2. Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding between Fullerton College and the Fullerton Police Department and/or Flying Lion, Inc. pertaining to the DFR trial program.

3. Any documents, reports, or presentations prepared by Fullerton College for or in collaboration with the Fullerton Police Department and/or Flying Lion, Inc. regarding the DFR program.

4. Any internal communications or documents within Fullerton College that discuss or reference the college’s involvement in or support for the FPD’s DFR program.

If any records are withheld, please provide a detailed justification for each withheld record or portion thereof, including the specific exemption that you believe justifies the withholding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Johnston

title: Diddy December 27, 1999, Shooting Incident at Club New York (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Diddy December 27, 1999, Shooting Incident at Club New York (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the following records related to the shooting incident that occurred on December 27, 1999, at Club New York in Manhattan:

1. Any and all police reports, incident reports, or other documents related to the shooting at Club New York on December 27, 1999. This includes reports filed by responding officers and any related correspondence.

2. Records pertaining to the arrest of Shyne (Jamal Barrow) and anyone else involved in the incident, including arrest reports, booking details, and any associated documents.

3. Documentation related to the charges filed against Shyne, Sean "Diddy" Combs, and Jennifer Lopez, including any records of court proceedings or related legal documents.

4. Any witness statements or interviews conducted in connection with the incident.

5.  Internal communications or documents related to media coverage of the incident, if available.

Please provide these records in electronic format if possible. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me before processing. If you need additional information to process this request, feel free to contact me at [Your Contact Information].

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Diddy December 27, 1999, Shooting Incident at Club New York (New York City Police Department)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Diddy December 27, 1999, Shooting Incident at Club New York (New York City Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the following records related to the shooting incident that occurred on December 27, 1999, at Club New York in Manhattan:

1. Any and all police reports, incident reports, or other documents related to the shooting at Club New York on December 27, 1999. This includes reports filed by responding officers and any related correspondence.

2. Records pertaining to the arrest of Shyne (Jamal Barrow) and anyone else involved in the incident, including arrest reports, booking details, and any associated documents.

3. Documentation related to the charges filed against Shyne, Sean "Diddy" Combs, and Jennifer Lopez, including any records of court proceedings or related legal documents.

4. Any witness statements or interviews conducted in connection with the incident.

5.  Internal communications or documents related to media coverage of the incident, if available.

Please provide these records in electronic format if possible. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me before processing. If you need additional information to process this request, feel free to contact me at [Your Contact Information].

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

title: Scientology trafficking files

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sceintology trafficking files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I am formally requesting the following records:

- All releasable documents that reference "Scientology" within any closed Human Trafficking investigation files, dated from 2008 onward.

I am an independent researcher exploring the multiple investigations into Scientology. This request is made solely to raise public awareness and for educational purposes. I believe this issue holds considerable public interest, particularly in light of a December 2012 article, which stated the U.S. Department of Homeland Security had been investigating allegations of human trafficking within the Church of Scientology. The investigation may have been conducted by the Tampa field office, with lead investigator Justin Deutsch.

Here is the article referencing the investigation.

https://tonyortega.org/2012/12/13/homeland-security-investigating-scientology-for-human-trafficking/

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the FBI file for Roscoe Pound (October 27, 1870 – June 28, 1964). FBI File Number: 77-74432. In response to my FOIA request the FBI has informed me in a letter dated 19 August 2024 that "Records potentially responsive to your request were transferred to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA).,, Use file number 77-HQ-74432 as a reference."

This file is cited in Hull, N. E. H. 1997. Roscoe Pound and Karl Llewellyn: Searching for an American Jurisprudence. Chicago: University of Chicago Press: 317 as FOIA Request number: 348815/190-73105. 

Roscoe Pound was an American legal scholar and educator. He served as dean of the University of Nebraska College of Law from 1903 to 1911 and was dean of Harvard Law School from 1916 to 1936. He was a member of Northwestern University, the University of Chicago Law School and the faculty at UCLA School of Law in the school's early years, from 1949 to 1952.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Jackson

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by NASA Public Access Link
communications.communication:
Dear Brett Carollo, 

Your request was received by NASA Public Access Link. The request was assigned tracking #24-01184-F-HQ. You seek the following: 

A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported in any way by NASA in the year 2016. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations for other years, including to this requester, who has made them public.A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported in any way by NASA in the year 2018. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations for other years, including to this requester, who has made them public.A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported in any way by NASA in the year 2019. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations for other years, including to this requester, who has made them public.A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported in any way by NASA in the year 2020. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations for other years, including to this requester, who has made them public.A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported in any way by NASA in the year 2022. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations for other years, including to this requester, who has made them public.A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported in any way by NASA in the year 2023. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations for other years, including to this requester, who has made them public. 

Please log into your account and review your submission. The application address is https://pal.hq.nasa.gov/. 

Thank you, 
NASA Public Access Link

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-01184-F-HQ
communications.communication:
This message concerns FOIA request 24-01184-F-HQ.

I am writing to appeal the rejection of my request for a fee waiver. This request was rejected on the grounds that I could not demonstrate that disclosure of the requested records to me would constitute a "significant" benefit to public knowledge of NASA'a activities. Specifically, my claim was characterized as "speculative." In considering my appeal, I ask whomever it may concern to consider that, in addition to my qualifications as stated in the original request, I am the editor-in-chief of a magazine (currently digital but soon to be in print) called "Cultural Engineering Studies," and I personally contributed an article to this magazine on NASA's relationship to Hollywood--an almost unexplored topic. So it seems arbitrary to conclude that this information will not benefit public awareness in a "significant" way. 

Thank you in advance for considering my appeal,

Brett Carollo
